title: Police say 3-year-old girl was killed accidentally with shotgun
content:
ABILENE, Texas - Police say a 3-year-old girl was shot accidentally with a shotgun Saturday.
Abilene police responded to the accidental shooting death in the 500 block of Washington Street.
According to police, the child was found dead from a gunshot wound. It remained unclear Monday how the child was shot.
Abilene police arrested Demetrius Lmar McDonald in connection with the shooting. He was inside the home at the time of the child's death. Police said McDonald is a felon and possessing a shotgun is prohibited.
After being questioned by police, McDonald was arrested for third-degree possession of a firearm by a felon.
McDonald's bond is set at $75,000. Police said additional charges may be considered by police after the full investigation.
A large neighborhood group gathered at the 700 block of North Treadaway Boulevard and tensions escalated, according to a KTXS photographer at the scene.
Police are asking the public to remain calm while the investigation continues.
KTXS will update this story as soon as we learn more.
